docs.snippet: TRENTON, Jan. 31--Because of the death of his nephew, Governor Byrne canceled today a projected trip to Washington, where he had planned to appeal for more Federal funds for New Jersey cities at a White House conference on economic problems....
docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON, Jan. 31--Because of the death of his nephew, Governor Byrne canceled today a projected trip to Washington, where he had planned to appeal for more Federal funds for New Jersey cities at a White House conference on economic problems.
docs.abstract: Gov Byrne cancels Washington trip to appeal for more funds for NJ cities at White House conf because of death of his nephew Christopher Byrne; conf was called by Pres Carter to develop ways to reduce unemployment without causing more pollution; state's Energy Comr Joel E Jacobson and other state, labor and Legis leaders will attend (S)

headline.main: Byrne Drops Trip to Washington Because of Death of His Nephew

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 31 (Reuters)--Gen. Oscar Molina Pallochia became Prime Minister, Minister of War, and commander of the army today. The 54-year-old general replaced Gen. Guillermo Arbulu Galliani, one of 14 senior officers who retired yesterday af...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 31 (Reuters)--Gen. Oscar Molina Pallochia became Prime Minister, Minister of War, and commander of the army today. The 54-year-old general replaced Gen. Guillermo Arbulu Galliani, one of 14 senior officers who retired yesterday after 35 years of service.
docs.abstract: Gen Oscar Molina Pallochia becomes Prime Min, War Min and Army Comdr, replacing Gen Guillermo Arbulu Galliani (S)

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 31--Nomination ballots for the yearly Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences awards were put in the mail yesterday, and as was predictable, there is already a minor controversy surrounding the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 31--Nomination ballots for the yearly Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences awards were put in the mail yesterday, and as was predictable, there is already a minor controversy surrounding the Oscars.
docs.abstract: Controversy has erupted over possible nomination of Vanessa Redgrave as best supporting actress for role in film Julia; some militant Jewish groups have called on members of Motion Picture Acad of Arts and Sciences not to vote for her because she helped finance documentary on plight of Palestinian refugees called The Palestinians; several Jewish leaders have deplored suggestion, saying it is reminiscent of film indus blacklisting scandals of McCarthy era; Dore Schary, Buck Henry and Howard Koch comment; illus

headline.main: Oscars Stir Redgrave Dispute Anew; Two Demands Made Performances Stressed

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 28--Argentine guerrillas have charged that the Argentine military junta sent an assassination team to Mexico to kill rebel leaders living in exile here....
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 28--Argentine guerrillas have charged that the Argentine military junta sent an assassination team to Mexico to kill rebel leaders living in exile here.
docs.abstract: Argentine mil guerrillas charge that mil junta sent assassination team to Mex to kill rebel leaders living in exile in Mex City; both govts silent; guerrilla group Montoneros says latest incident occurred on Jan 2 with capture in Mar del Plata, Argentina, of guerrilla leader Tulio Valenzuela, along with his companion Raquel Negg and son (M)

headline.main: ARGENTINA ACCUSED OF A PLOT IN MEXICO; Guerrillas Say Junta Sent Team to Kill Rebel Leaders Living in Exile but Effort Failed Frictions Are Avoided Alleged Team Members Named Press Conference Called

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The tricky and controversial business of immortalizing people in sports will get a major new test tomorrow when 18 men meet in the Americana Hotel to cast votes for baseball's Hall of Fame....
docs.lead_paragraph: The tricky and controversial business of immortalizing people in sports will get a major new test tomorrow when 18 men meet in the Americana Hotel to cast votes for baseball's Hall of Fame.

headline.main: A New Hall of Fame Committee Tackles an Old Baseball Problem; Committees Combined A New Approach to Picking Hall of Famers Stage Was Set

docs.snippet: OUTDOOR sportsmen say it is better to put on skis than to curse the snow--or words to that effect. The fact is, when  the forecast is frigid and frosted and the slopes are crystal-coated, the atmosphere is notably jubilant in local ski shops....
docs.lead_paragraph: OUTDOOR sportsmen say it is better to put on skis than to curse the snow--or words to that effect. The fact is, when the forecast is frigid and frosted and the slopes are crystal-coated, the atmosphere is notably jubilant in local ski shops.

headline.main: SHOP TALK; 'Skiers Are the Buyingest People'

docs.snippet: Oscar Homolka, for decades one of the leading character actors of stage, theatre and television, with a range from somber terror to chortling affability, died Friday in Sussex, England. He was 79 years old....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oscar Homolka, for decades one of the leading character actors of stage, theatre and television, with a range from somber terror to chortling affability, died Friday in Sussex, England. He was 79 years old.

headline.main: Oscar Homolka, Actor, Dies at 79; The Uncle in 'I Remember Mama'; Over 400 Plays Tired of City

docs.snippet: When the next National Basketball Association season arrives, uniform No. 17 will hang from the rafters of Boston Garden, along with 13 championship flags and the retired numbers of other Celtic greats, including Bill Russell, Bob Cousy and Tom He...
docs.lead_paragraph: When the next National Basketball Association season arrives, uniform No. 17 will hang from the rafters of Boston Garden, along with 13 championship flags and the retired numbers of other Celtic greats, including Bill Russell, Bob Cousy and Tom Heinsohn.

headline.main: Retirement of Havlicek to Remove Another Link to Celtic Glory Years; Havlicek Leaves His Marks His Most Trying Season 'The Havlicek Championship' Cut in Celtic Mold
